MENACE.Definition: threat, something that is likely to cause harm

SYNTHESISED.Definition: produce a substance via a chemical reaction

MORPHINE.Definition: a drug made from opium, often used for pain relief

SYRINGES.Definition: a medical piece of equipment used for sucking liquid out or inserting liquid into somewhere

VEINS.Definition: the tubes that carry blood to the heart

VETERANS.Definition: soldiers who fought in a war

INSOMNIA.Definition: the condition of not being able to sleep

CATALOGUE.Definition: a magazine with a list of things you can buy

HIPPY.Definition: someone in the 1960s and 1970s who was against violence

RAID.Definition: make a surprise visit (especially by police or soldiers)

VILIFY.Definition: to talk about in a negative way in order to get others to develop a negative opinion (of that person or group)

INORDINATE.Definition: much more than expected or would be fair

ACCESSIBILITY.Definition: ease of use, ease to get

OPIUM.Definition: a drug made from poppy seeds

DEVASTATING.Definition: very bad, causing a lot of damage

OPIATES.Definition: drugs that contain opium, often used for pain relief

POLICYMAKERS.Definition: people who decide policy and laws

IMPLICIT.Definition: suggested or understood, but not said

GATEWAY DRUGS.Definition: drugs that make it more likely that a harder (and more dangerous) drug will be used

LIBERTARIAN.Definition: someone who thinks that people should be free to do what they please without government interference

DRUG REHABILITATION.Definition: helping drug addicts stop using drugs

COUNTER ARGUMENT.Definition: a point that is opposite to what was previously said

PROPHECIES.Definition: statements about what will happen in the future
